story.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a description of how something happened, that is intended to entertain people, and may be true or imaginary
story.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: We cuddled together over a bedtime story.
The film was based on a true story.
Don’t be frightened – it’s only a story  (=it is imaginary).
Mommy, will you read me a story?
story.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a report in a newspaper or news broadcast about a recent event, or something that is reported on
story.translation[0].definitions[1].note: cover story (=the main story in a magazine, which is about the picture on the cover)
story.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: ‘The Observer’ ran a story about the scandal  (=printed it).
story.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: an account of something that has happened, usually one that people tell each other, and which may not be true
story.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The full story of what happened has never been reported.
Her parents did not believe her story.
First, he wanted to hear Matthew’s side of the story (=his description of what happened).
He was having an affair with Julie, or so the story goes (=people are saying this).
story.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: an excuse or explanation, especially one that you have invented
story.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Where were you? And don’t give me some story about working late!
Well, that’s my story  (=that is what I say happened), and I’m sticking to it.
story.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a description of the most important events in someone’s life or in the development of something
story.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: He wanted to have his life story told on film.
story.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a floor or level of a building
story.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: what happens in a film, play, or book
story.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: The story is similar in all her books.
story.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: a lie – used by children or when speaking to children
story.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a description of how something happened, that is intended to entertain people, and may be true or imaginary
story.translation[0].note_box[0].section: ‘Schindler’s List’ tells the true story of Oskar Schindler.
a classic story about a little girl who falls down a rabbit hole
He has published two collections of short stories.
Enid Blyton is famous for writing children’s stories.
‘Romeo and Juliet’ is a classic love story.
She looked like a princess in a fairy story.
an exciting adventure story for children
Most detective stories are about a murder.
They sat round the fire telling ghost stories.
He remembered his mother reading him a bedtime story.
Would you like me to tell you a story?
She read a lot of detective stories.
The story was written by Lewis Carroll.
story.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 2: a report in a newspaper or news broadcast about a recent event, or something that is reported on
story.translation[0].note_box[1].section: He had promised the newspaper a big story on a major celebrity.
The floods were the lead story on the news that evening.
The Times published a front-page story about the scandal.
Hello magazine did a cover story on her last year.
I went to Iraq to do a story on the war.
The News of the World decided not to print the story.
There wasn’t enough definite information to run the story.
Her family complained about the way that journalists had covered the story.
The Daily Mail was the paper which broke the story.
We may never know who leaked the story to the press.
I still remember the shock when that story broke.
story.translation[0].note_box[2].heading: – Meanings 3 & 4
story.translation[0].note_box[2].section: tell (somebody) a story
I’d better tell you the whole story from the beginning.
He laughed as he recounted the story.
give (somebody) a story
I had the feeling that she wasn’t giving me the full story.
hear a story
I’ve heard that story a hundred times.
make up/invent a story
She confessed to making up the story of being abducted.
stick to your story
He didn’t believe her at first, but she stuck to her story.
change your story
During police interviews, Harper changed his story several times.
believe a story
The jury did not believe Evans’s story.
swap stories
They swapped stories and shared their experiences.
the story goes
The story goes that he was drowned off the south coast, but not everyone believed it.
a story goes around
A story went around that she had been having an affair.
the full/whole story
I did not know the full story.
a plausible/convincing story
She tried to think up a convincing story to tell her parents.
a remarkable story
The film tells the remarkable story of their escape from a prison camp.
an apocryphal story
There are many apocryphal stories about him.
the inside story
Though I’d seen the official report, I wanted the inside story.
somebody’s side of the story
I would like to give my side of the story.
story.translation[0].note_box[3].section: story
a description of how something happened that is intended to entertain people, and may be true or imaginary
a ghost story
a love story
It’s a story about a man who loses his memory.
a book of short stories
tale
a story about strange imaginary events, or exciting events that happened in the past
a fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen
I loved hearing tales of his travels.
myth
a very old imaginary story about gods and magical creatures
an ancient myth
Greek and Roman myths
legend
an old story about brave people or magical events that are probably not true
popular legends of the creation of the world
According to legend, King Arthur was buried there.
fable
a traditional imaginary short story that teaches a moral lesson, especially a story about animals
the fable of the tortoise and the hare
a Chinese fable
epic
a story told in a long book, film, or poem which is about great or exciting events, especially in history
an epic about 13th-century Scottish hero William Wallace
saga
a story about a series of events that take place over a long period of time, especially events involving one family
a family saga beginning in the 1880s
yarn
a long exciting story that is not completely true
The movie’s a rattling good yarn and full of action.
